wikipedia_page.main: Drummond St Clair Ford (16 December 1907 – 12 December 1942) was a Scottish international rugby union player, who was killed in World War II.He was capped five times for Scotland between 1930–32, scoring three tries in that period. He also played for United Services Portsmouth Rugby Football Club and Royal Navy Rugby Union.
